rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;8f9d21de.1503">   <title>FW: Nurturing University Community Engagement | Integration, Innovation and Impact </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;8f9d21de.1503</link>   <description> Dear all, I have been asked by our member Sara Parker to advertise call for paper for the International Conference on \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdNurturing University Community Engagement: Integration, Innovation and Impact&quot;. For more information, please visit this link: http://nsswengage.org/ Kind regards Krishna Adhikari General Secretary BNAC bnac.ac.uk    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-04T09:59:58+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Krishna Adhikari</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;8f9d21de.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;cd979696.1502">   <title>FW: News </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;cd979696.1502</link>   <description> Dear all,<br><br>It is our pleasure to share with you the news that Professor Surya Subedi, the founding Chairman of BNAC, has been appointed as a member of a Task Force on Investment Policy by by the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, and the International Centre for Trade and Sustainable Development in Geneva. If you would like to read the summary of the news, please find the following text    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-28T13:57:53+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Krishna Adhikari</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;cd979696.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;7d445829.1502">   <title>Fwd: SOAS South Asia Institute: 2nd Annual Graduate Workshop on South Asia Cityscapes: Social, economic and cultural transformations @ SOAS, 8 June 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;7d445829.1502</link>   <description> Dear colleague<br><br>My apologies: the deadline for offers of papers for this workshop was<br>originally 27 February but has been now put back to 20 March: this was<br>changed in the text headed 'registration', but not in the main heading of<br>the email we sent out on Wednesday. Please do encourage students who wish<br>to contribute but were put off by the original deadline to please send in<br>abstracts: they still have time! [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-27T16:04:57+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Michael Hutt</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;7d445829.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;45e4d227.1502">   <title>Fw: New publication from Social Science Baha </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;45e4d227.1502</link>   <description> Now available in Kathmandu bookstores<br><br>The Dynamics of Health in Nepal<br>Edited by Sharada Prasad Wasti, Padam Simkhada &amp; Edwin van Teijlingen<br>2015, pp. xiv+240<br>ISBN: 978 9937 2 9095 1<br>Online orders can be placed here&lt;http://himalbooks.com/shop/products/The-Dynamics-of-Health-in-Nepal.html&gt;.<br>Nepal has experienced tremendous social, economic and political transformations in recent years. This is true of the health sector as well. But despite strong advances in the provision of services, health as an agenda for research has not been fully explored. This book is an attempt to highlight the developments that have taken place in different aspects of this sector and also to [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-25T19:33:03+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Edwin Van Teijlingen</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;45e4d227.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;f5b0d4d3.1502">   <title>SOAS South Asia Institute: 2nd Annual Graduate Workshop on South Asia Cityscapes: Social, economic and cultural transformations @ SOAS, 8 June 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;f5b0d4d3.1502</link>   <description> SOAS South Asia Institute<br>Second Annual Graduate Workshop<br>*South Asia Cityscapes: Social, economic and cultural transformations *<br><br>*Date:* 8 June 2015*, *9:00am - 6.00pm<br><br>*Venue:* Meet 116, Russell Square Main Building, SOAS, University of London<br>Call for Papers - Deadline 27th February 2015<br><br>Urbanising processes are taking place across the South Asian region, the<br>home of more than a fifth of humanity. South Asian cityscapes are<br>consequently playing a significant role in shaping social, economic and<br>cultural formations. Arjun Appadurai\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds notion of \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdfive scapes\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd (or flows)<br>conceptualises the rapid processes by which ideas, information, people,<br>finances, and technologies are constantly [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-25T17:13:57+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Michael Hutt</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;f5b0d4d3.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;8b675c74.1502">   <title>2015 Nepal Study Day: final call </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;8b675c74.1502</link>   <description> BRITAIN-NEPAL ACADEMIC COUNCIL<br><br>Call for Papers for the 13th Nepal Study Day<br><br>Hosted by the South Asia Institute, SOAS University of London<br><br>16-17th April, 2015<br><br>The Britain Nepal Academic Council (BNAC) invites scholars and<br>practitioners from all disciplines to participate in the 13thBNAC Nepal<br>Study Days. All presentations should focus on Nepal, its diaspora and the<br>Nepali cultural world. We invite two kinds of presentations: [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-19T19:16:54+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Bnac Studyday</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;8b675c74.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;ed181138.1502">   <title>Fwd: CNSUK's Talk Programme - Wednesday 18 February 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;ed181138.1502</link>   <description> Dear all,<br><br>sorry, attachment is here.<br><br>Krishna   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-16T13:42:19+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Krishna Adhikari</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;ed181138.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;cbf7eb70.1502">   <title>Re: CNSUK's Talk Programme - Wednesday 18 February 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;cbf7eb70.1502</link>   <description> Dear All,<br><br>Centre for Nepal Studies (CNSUK) is organising a talk programme on<br>'Migration and mobility in South Asia and South Asian Diaspora' between<br>12.00 and 16.00 on 18th February 2015. The programme will talk place at<br>Bhetghat Restaurant, Aldershot. Attached is the flyer of the programme.<br>Hope you will be able to attend the programme. Please contact Dr Chandra<br>Laksamba &lt;chandra.laksamba@cnsuk.org.uk&gt; for more information. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-16T13:40:31+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Krishna Adhikari</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;cbf7eb70.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;d2812028.1502">   <title>First Annual Chautari Foundation Lecture 2015 by Bikash Pandey </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;d2812028.1502</link>   <description> MCFoundationLecture_Poster.jpg    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-13T12:44:32+05:45</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Pratyoush Onta</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;d2812028.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;8ed81758.1502">   <title>FW: Nepali Awaaz 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;8ed81758.1502</link>   <description> Dear all,<br><br>The following information from LSESU Nepalese Society regarding their first annual conference, &quot;Nepali Awaaz&quot; might be of your interest.<br><br>Regards<br>Krishna Adhikari<br>GS, BNAC   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-08T08:49:50+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Krishna Adhikari</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;8ed81758.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;32313997.1502">   <title>Giving a talk at Martin Chautari </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;32313997.1502</link>   <description> Dear Academic Colleagues (who are not based in Nepal):<br><br>If you plan to be in Kathmandu in the coming months and would like to<br>present your completed research at Martin Chautari (i.e., meaning you have<br>mostly processed the research findings and have a written draft to present<br>to your peers in Nepal), please contact either Devendra Uprety<br>(upretydevendra@gmail.com) or Pratyoush Onta (sinhas@mos.com.np) off this<br>list with [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-06T12:23:35+05:45</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Pratyoush Onta</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;32313997.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;2eea690d.1502">   <title>Unsubscribing from the mailing list </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;2eea690d.1502</link>   <description> Dear subscribers<br><br>I have been asked on a few occasions about unsubscribing from this mailing<br>list. For future reference (though of course we would rather you stayed<br>with us), please note that this can be done through this link:<br><br>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?SUBED1=bnac&amp;A=1<br><br>With thanks and all best wishes<br><br>Celayne.   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-05T14:42:30+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>celayne heaton shrestha</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;2eea690d.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;7481cab6.1502">   <title>New BNAC account details </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;7481cab6.1502</link>   <description> **apologies for repeated posting**<br><br>Dear subscribers<br><br>Following on from a previous mail by Prof David Gellner, the BNAC now has a<br>new bank account. Please contact me (celayne.hs@gmail.com) for the<br>details of our new account to join the BNAC, renew your membership for 2015<br>or alter the details of any existing standing orders.<br><br>With many thanks and all best wishes [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-05T10:34:26+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>celayne heaton shrestha</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;7481cab6.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;b1ad00d2.1502">   <title>Re: Happy New Year 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;b1ad00d2.1502</link>   <description> Dear subscribers<br><br>Following on from a previous mail by Prof David Gellner, the BNAC now has a<br>new bank account. Please contact me (celayne.hs@gmail.com) for the<br>details of our new account to join the BNAC, renew your membership for 2015<br>or alter the details of any existing standing orders.<br><br>With many thanks and all best wishes [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-05T10:16:47+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>celayne heaton shrestha</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;b1ad00d2.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;bc71e2a6.1501">   <title>Fwd: [SOAS] CfP for 2nd Annual SSAI Graduate Workshop (Deadline 27th Feb 2015)- South Asia Cityscapes: Social, economic and cultural transformations @ SOAS, 8 June 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;bc71e2a6.1501</link>   <description> ---------- Forwarded message ----------<br>From: Sana Shah &lt;ss149@soas.ac.uk&gt;<br>Date: 28 January 2015 at 14:15<br>Subject: [SOAS] CfP for 2nd Annual SSAI Graduate Workshop (Deadline 27th<br>Feb 2015)- South Asia Cityscapes: Social, economic and cultural<br>transformations @ SOAS, 8 June 2015<br>To: SSAIMEMBERS-L@listserv.soas.ac.uk<br><br>Dear colleagues,<br><br>Can I kindly ask you to help circulate this CfP below?<br><br>Thank you very much. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-28T14:24:44+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Michael Hutt</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;bc71e2a6.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;9fc2d39c.1501">   <title>Fwd: Nepal: Biodiversity and Conservation, Now and the Future - Symposium 26 February 2016 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;9fc2d39c.1501</link>   <description> ---------- Forwarded message ----------<br>From: Ann Sylph &lt;Ann.Sylph@zsl.org&gt;<br>Date: 22 January 2015 at 12:36<br>Subject: Nepal: Biodiversity and Conservation, Now and the Future -<br>Symposium 26 February 2016<br>To: BRITAINNEPAL200@jiscmail.ac.uk<br><br>Dear All<br><br>I am pleased to announce that ZSL will be hosting a one-day symposium<br>`Nepal : Biodiversity and Conservation, Now and the Future' on 26 February<br>2016.<br><br>This will form part of the Britain Nepal 200 celebrations. The symposium is<br>being organised by ZSL, Royal Botanic Gardens Edinburgh and the Linnean<br>Society of London. It will be held at ZSL in Regent's Park, London. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-23T08:53:52+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Michael Hutt</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;9fc2d39c.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;6f96c040.1501">   <title>Re: new issue of SINHAS available in print </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;6f96c040.1501</link>   <description> Correction needed in the previous post<br><br>The email address of Mandala Book Point is: books@mos.com.np    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-20T13:58:07+05:45</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Pratyoush Onta</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;6f96c040.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;e3035ff1.1501">   <title>new issue of SINHAS available in print </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;e3035ff1.1501</link>   <description> Studies in Nepali History and Society (SINHAS)<br><br>Volume 18 No. 2 December 2013 (Pus 2070 v.s.)<br><br>CONTENTS<br><br>Special Theme: Gender and Contemporary Experience in Nepal<br><br>Guest edited by Barbara Hypatia Grossman-Thompson<br><br>Introduction: New Research on Gender and Contemporary Experience in Nepal<br><br>Barbara Hypatia Grossman-Thompson<br><br>Articles<br><br>The Fragility and Flexibility of Culture: Manifestations of Gender and<br>Modernity within the Dangaura Tharu Sakhy\ufffd\ufffd-Paiy\ufffd\ufffd N\ufffd\ufffdc [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-20T13:50:12+05:45</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Pratyoush Onta</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;e3035ff1.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;25bea2f5.1501">   <title>Fwd: The Cultures of Resistance Scholarships for 2015-16: applications now open </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;25bea2f5.1501</link>   <description> Dear all<br><br>Happy Belayati New Year! Please see below for details of a new Masters<br>scholarship scheme at SOAS. Nepal is listed as one of the countries from<br>which applications are invited. Please share with anyone who might be<br>eligible and interested.<br><br>Many thanks<br><br>MH<br><br>---------- Forwarded message ----------<br>From: Jo\ufffd\ufffdo Silva &lt;js75@soas.ac.uk&gt;<br>Date: 7 January 2015 at 17:21<br>Subject: The Cultures of Resistance Scholarships for 2015-16: applications<br>now open<br>To: [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-07T17:40:21+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Michael Hutt</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;25bea2f5.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;2acc696f.1501">   <title>Happy New Year 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;2acc696f.1501</link>   <description> Dear subscribers to the BNAC list,<br><br>please find attached a letter from me, as Chair of BNAC, Krishna Adhikari, as Secretary, and Celayne Heaton Shrestha, as Treasurer outlining our activities for the coming year and inviting you either to join the BNAC (if you have not already done so, or have lapsed), or to renew your membership now. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-02T13:13:56+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>David Gellner</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;2acc696f.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;8a1b2943.1412">   <title>New issue of Media Adhyayan [Media Studies 9] available in print </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;8a1b2943.1412</link>   <description> *Media Adhyayan 9 [Media Studies 9]*<br><br>Edited by Devraj Humagain, Pratyoush Onta, Shekhar Parajulee, Harsha Man<br>Maharjan and Arjun Panthi<br><br>2014; Chautari Book Series 83<br><br>Published and distributed by Bhrikuti Academic Publications, Kathmandu<br><br>Founded in 2006, *Media Adhyayan* is the only academic journal devoted to a<br>multidisciplinary study of issues related to the media in Nepal. Edited by<br>researchers associated with the media research group of Martin Chautari<br>(MC) in Kathmandu, the first eight issues of this annual Nepali language<br>journal were published by MC. Centre for Himalayan Studies-CNRS<br><br>CALL FOR PAPERS<br>The Fourth Annual Kathmandu Conference on Nepal and the Himalaya<br>22-24 July, 2015, Kathmandu<br><br>Submission deadline: 22 December, 2014<br><br>Proposals are invited for stand-alone papers or three-paper panels.<br><br>Papers<br><br>Papers can deal with any aspect of life in Nepal and the Himalaya from a social science perspective. Papers can also be comparative so long as Nepal or the Himalaya is included in the comparison. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-04T10:40:44+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>David Gellner</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;7e0428.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;bf6915f8.1412">   <title>'The Crucible of Revolution: what it means to be a Nepali Maoist' talk by Bhaskar Gautam at SOAS 10 December </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;bf6915f8.1412</link>   <description> *Wednesday 10 December 2014*The Crucible of Revolution: what it means to be<br>a Nepali Maoist<br>Bhaskar Gautam (SSAI Visiting Fellow)<br>17:15-19:00<br>Room FG01, Ground Floor, Faber Building, Russell Square<br><br>*Abstract*Nepal in recent years has moved away from the fetishism of<br>constitutional monarchy and parliamentary democracy. Its political<br>discourses have shifted to urgent and grave question such as how to<br>redesign the polity so that it can embrace and promote diversity and<br>development with justice. This concern is at the very heart of the project<br>of radical democracy. Drawing on the intellectual history of the Maoist<br>Movement, Dr Gautam will discuss [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-03T11:04:56+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Michael Hutt</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;bf6915f8.1412</dc:identifier> </item>   </rdf:RDF>
